result.execSummary:
The defendant Sylvester Herring Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Fine of $2,400.00, all applicable court costs, fees, surcharges, DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under SEc. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence defendant is currenlty serving.
Defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program if deemed appropriate by Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain fulltime employment.  Complete a job training program to enhance ability to obtain employment.
comply with the standard rules of Extended Supervision.
Cooperate and participate with AODA asessment.  Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide  DNA sample unless previously done, pay DNA surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Drive Safety Plan signed and filed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sylvester Herring Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA/SENTENCING Transcript (42 pages) commencing JULY 14, 2015 received and filed.
Denying Motion to Vacate The DNA Surcharge, signed and filed.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Conen, Br. 30, for review. jbs
Motion Regarding Re-Assessment of the Deoxyribonucleic Acid Surcharge.
Associated with Charge #1/corrected to show AODA/cOURT order for IDP Related Offense DRiver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.
(8) Defendant's Character Witness Letters; filed.

Defendant Sylvester Herring in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Timothy J. Cotter for Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

 Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense, Briana H., Alicia H., and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:    The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS, concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.
 INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS.
Credit given for 165 days time served if revoked.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program, IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 1):
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* Seek and maintain full-time employment.
* Complete a job training program to enhance ability to obtain employment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA asssessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample (unless previously done) and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.   The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY fine in the amount of $2,400.00.  The Court ordered that the fine be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered defendant's driver operating privileges REVOKED for a period of 36 months.
* Any vehicle titled in the defendant's name or driven by the defendant is to have an ignition interlock device installed for a period of 3 years.
* Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan.
Crime Victim Impact Statement with attached Restitution Worksheet.

Defendant Sylvester Herring in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Timothy J. Cotter for Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rightes form.
FILED, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Defendant's Blood Alcohol Test Results; filed.

Defendant Sylvester Herring in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Timothy J. Cotter for Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case adjourned to 07-14-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court fort Adjourned Plea and Sentencing Hearing.
Order to Produce for Plea/Sentencing Hearing on July 13, 2-15 @ 8:30am received and filed

Defendant Sylvester Herring NOT in court; in custody.  Attorney Daryl A Kastenson appeared on behalf of the defendant.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties unable to proceed with a Plea and Sentencing Hearing today.
Judge Donald is currently in trial on an unrelated matter.
Atty. Kastenson moves to withdraw due to him leaving the Public Defender's Office next week.
Court GRANTS motion and "allows" Atty. Kastenson to withdraw as counsel for the defendant.
Atty. Daryl Kastenson is now discharged.
Case adjourned to 07-13-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing.

**Case scheduled with Atty. Valeria Taylor's calendar.
from defendant's wife; filed.

Parties request a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.

Attorney Daryl A Kastenson in court, defendant Sylvester Herring not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties still under negotiations and request another scheduling conference date.
Case adjourned to 03-16-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Scheduling Conference.

Defendant Sylvester Herring in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Sylvester Herring in custody.  Franco Mineo for Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02 due to the assignment of the Assistant District Attorney.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Sylvester Herring in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Sylvester Herring in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
